Studies in American character; actors, authors, clergymen, financiers, insurance, lawyer, merchant, philanthropist, politicians, railroadman, scientist.

New empires in the Northwest.

History of the United States; for the use of common schools.
Diary and letters of Phebe M. Irish.
The Hudson river by pen and pencil. Illustrated with sixty engravings on wood,

The speech of His Excellency Governor Strong, delivered before the legislature of Massachusetts, October 16, 1812, with documents, which accompanied the same. To which is added, The answer of the House of Representatives.
Collection of American victories,
Die Stadt Chicago, ihre Söhne und ihre Bürger im allgemeinen; die Kindheit und Entwicklung der Weltstadt. Chicago während und nach der Weltausstellung.
The first book of history, for children and youth.
Speech at the Union meeting in New York, December 19th, 1859.

Ceremonies connected with the Inauguration of the mausoleum and the unveiling of the recumbent figure of General Robert Edward Lee, at Washington and Lee University, Lexington, Va., June 28, 1883. Oration of John W. Daniel. Historical sketch of the Lee Memorial Association.
Proceedings of the Conference Convention in Washington City, on the death of Hon. J.C. Wright, one of the commissioners from the State of Ohio.
The life of George Washington,
The races and their future; a plea for their education.

The progress of the age and the Union of the States; an address delivered before the Tulliphoboian Society of St. John's College, Frederick, Maryland at their first collegiate commencement, July 16th, 1850.
Vindication of A.B. Norton, from the attacks of his enemies made in the Texas Legislature, April 8th, 1861.
Six months in the West Indies in 1825.
New Hampshire as it is.
Hombres notables de Cuyo.
America para los americanos.
Brazil at the Louisiana Purchase Exposition, St. Louis 1904.
La question Haitienne,
Perilous adventures by land and sea, in Europe, Asia, Africa and America.
Irish wonders; the ghosts, giants, pookas, demons, leprechawns, banshees, fairies, witches, widows, old maids, and other marvels of the Emerald Isle; popular tales as told by the people.
Boys' own book; a complete encyclopedia of athletic, scientific, outdoor and indoor sports.
Hindu magic; an expose of the tricks of the Yogis and fakirs of India.
Card-sharpers; their tricks exposed; or, The art of always winning.

Wehman Bros.' tricks with coins; or, Modern coin manipulation, embracing every sleight and subtlety invented and known, including ... a complete explanation of his world famous coin creation "The miser's dream".

Boy's own book, extended; a complete encyclopedia of all athletic, scientific, recreative, outdoor and indoor exercises and diversions including The boy's own book, The book of gymnastics and Parlor magic.
Practical ventriloquism; being a thoroughly reliable guide to the art of voice throwing and vocal mimicry by an entirely novel systemof graded exercises.
Dick's parlor exhibitions containing a large and varied collection of elegant home amusements ... with complete text and detailed directions for rendering them effective and successful.
Modern card tricks and how to do them; containing all the principles of sleight-of-hand, with careful and easy instructions.

Wehman's wizards' manual; a practical treatise on mind reading, according to Stuart Cumberland and the late Washington Irving Bishop; ventriloquism, as practised by Valentine Vox and others; sleight of hand; secrets and methods of performing many marvelous mysteries, such as have astonished the public of all nations.
Magical notes & notions.
Magician's book of conjuring.
The game of draughts.
Auction bridge up-to-date; containing the laws of auction bridge, as framed by a joint committee of the Portland and Bath Clubs, and approved and adopted by the committee of the Portland Club.
Reversi and go bang,
Zig-zag, the boy conjurer; or, Life on and off stage,
Parlor magic; a series of tricks made easy for evening parties and other entertainments.
The modern conjurer and drawing-room entertainer.
Naemen trud i kapital.

When wilderness was king; a tale of the Illinois country.
